entry.name: ActiveDirectory_AdminGroups
entry.description: Lists all members of Administrator and Domain Admin groups.

attribute.name: scriptgroovy

datapoint.name: AnyChange
datapoint.description: A change was detected in the membership or configuration of Active Directory Administrative Groups.

attribute.name: scriptgroovy

datapoint.name: AnyChange
datapoint.description: A change was detected in the configuration or membership of Active Directory Users.

entry.name: ActiveDirectory_SitesSubnets

datapoint.name: AnyChange
datapoint.description: A change was detected in the configuration or properties of the Active Directory Sites and Subnets.

entry.name: ActiveDirectory_PasswordPolicy
entry.description: Analyzes the default domain password policy - and alerts on deviations from Microsoft best practice recommendations.

attribute.name: scriptgroovy

datapoint.name: PasswordHistoryCount
datapoint.description: This sets how frequently old passwords can be reused. With this policy, you can discourage users from alternating between several common passwords.

datapoint.name: ComplexityEnabled
datapoint.description: These facilities enforce the use of secure passwords.

datapoint.name: LockoutDurationMinutes
datapoint.description: The Account lockout duration determines the number of minutes that a locked-out account remains locked out before automatically becoming unlocked. https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh994569(v=ws.11).aspx

datapoint.name: LockoutObservationWindow
datapoint.description: The range of time in which the system increments the incorrect logon count.

datapoint.name: LockoutThreshold
datapoint.description: The Account lockout threshold policy setting determines the number of failed sign-in attempts that will cause a user account to be locked. https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh994574(v=ws.11).aspx

datapoint.name: MaxPasswordAgeDays
datapoint.description: This determines how long users can keep a password before they have to change it. The aim is to force users to change their passwords periodically. Default alert threshold set here is 6 months (179 days.)

datapoint.name: MinPasswordAgeDays
datapoint.description: The Minimum password age policy setting determines the period of time (in days) that a password can be used before the system requires the user to change it.

datapoint.name: MinPasswordLength
datapoint.description: This sets the minimum number of characters for a password. If you havenâ€™t changed the default setting, you should do so immediately. https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff741764.aspx

datapoint.name: ReversibleEncryptionEnabled
datapoint.description: Storing encrypted passwords in a way that is reversible means that the encrypted passwords can be decrypted. https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh994559(v=ws.11).aspx

datapoint.name: AnyChange
datapoint.description: A change was detected in the Active Directory Default Domain Password Policy.
